page.title: 12FULFORTH FARM P3
page.content: Potatoes are also grown(the acreage of which has reduced after two years of poor prices). If possible winter barley and winter wheat are grown,if conditions are difficult in the autumn spring barley is used.The yields should be 2tons/acre or above and wheat maybe a little more ,but not above 3tons/acre. The grain is used partly for cattle and sheep feed.The straw is not burnt these days ,in fact it can be treated with protein supplement and used as fodder for cows. As well as being used for grazing the grass is made into hay and silage ideally two thirds for hay and the rest silage.The silage is made into big round bales and packed into black plastic bags.Again a contractor comes in with a big baler when the grass is ready.The cost per bale is Â£2.20.
